page.title: 11 A DESCRIPTION OF WADSLEY
page.content: THE AREA IS TO THE NORTH WEST OF SHEFFIELD IN BETWEEN THE VALLEYS OF THE RIVERS DON AND LOXLEY,WHICH MEET TO THE EAST OF THE AREA. THE{LANDSCAPE}IS A MIXTURE OF HOUSING, OPEN HEATHLAND AND FARMING.IT INCLUDES THE VILLAGES OF WADSLEY AND WORRALL WHICH WERE MENTIONED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK AND ARE NOW SUBURBS OF SHEFFIELD. { CHANGES}IN THE LAST TWO OR THREE DECADES HAVE BEEN;COTTAGES HAVE BEEN DEMOLISHED AND REPLACED BY HOUSING ESTATES. BUSES ARE A CONVENIENT AND SAFE{TRANSPORT}BUT BUS TIMES ARE A PROBLEM. TEENAGERS USE BAD LANGUAGE AND VANDALISE BUS STOPS. PEOPLE HAVE MORE TO DO NOW IN THEIR {LEISURE}TIME.SHOPS HAVE ALL CHANGED OWNERS AND SHOP KEEPERS ARE VERY FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL TO SHOPPERS.
